title: Resume
text:
Education

Master of Data Science
The University of British Columbia, Canada
September 2023 – June 2024
- Master of Data Science (Domestic/International) Scholarship awarded for academic and leadership achievements. - GPA: 91% - Capstone Project: Project DrillSense partnered with RioTinto. Created a dashboard with Dash library and GIS to visualize global mining trends and incorporated ML predictive algorithms (Random Forest was selected in the end) to identify future drillholes based on commodity, region, and other features.


Master’s Degree in Corporate Finance
Universidad de las Américas Puebla, Mexico
June 2020 – December 2021
- Specialization in Business Financial Management - Summa Cum Laude, GPA 3.96/4.00 - Institutional scholarship granted (60% of tuition covered) - Comprehensive Project: “Consulting and development of a business solution for a beauty products franchise that wants to expand in times of Covid”


Bachelor’s Degree in Actuarial Sciences
Universidad de las Américas Puebla, Mexico
August 2016 – June 2020
- Magna Cum Laude, GPA 3.92/4.00 - School of Science Scholar Award for achieving the highest marks in 2019 - Excellence scholarship granted (100% of tuition covered)

title: Resume
text:
Experience

Data Scientist
DATAKNOW S.A.S., Mexico
August 2022 – August 2023
- Clustered databases with ML (k-means, k-prototypes, DBSCAN, etc.) to combat money laundering and financing of terrorism by profiling customers and identifying revealing insights as required by Colombian law for various Grupo Bancolombia bank entities. - Developed Python scripts, pipelines, and workflows to ensure the reproducibility of the best models identified for future use.


Data Analyst
INDRA MINSAIT BUSINESS CONSULTING, Mexico
February 2022 – July 2022
- Identified, reconciled, and corrected Cross Currency Swaps and Bonds’ hedging strategies between the bank’s storage systems. - Automated Roll Over reports in VBA following IFRS9 standards, creating an output folder as a source for Salesforce and Murex to retrieve results. - Homologated and updated accounting rules in Murex to align with the new accounting structure of the bank.


Data Analyst (Internship)
Mexican Railways National Museum, Mexico
June 2019 – March 2020
- Conducted and analyzed museum statistics surveys for the National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI). - Developed VBA Userforms to automate the survey data capture and uploading process to INEGI’s platform. - Created and periodically tuned an R script to generate standardized reports with graphs, figures, and insights from Excel data.

title: Resume
text:

Microsoft: AZ-900 (Feb 2022)

Society of Actuaries: P (July 2020), FM (December 2020), IFM (November 2021), studying for SRM

Informatica: Cloud Data Integration (CDI) Partner Bootcamp Associate Certification (October 2022)

text:
Technical Skills

Frameworks: PyTorch, Hadoop

Cloud Platforms: Azure, AWS

title: Resume
text:
Awards
Math Olympiad Winner, Mexican Mathematical Olympiad
2012 - 2015
- Junior Olympiad Bronze Medal Winner in 2012 and 2013
- Senior Olympiad Finalist in 2014 and 2015

title: Resume
text:
Personal Projects
Smart home automation with Home Assistant open-source software and AWS
2021
- Created a local server with a Raspberry Pi and configured Home Assistant open-source software to control smart home devices locally without proprietary apps. - Developed an AWS Lambda function to connect Alexa with the local ecosystem for voice control of smart devices.
Android devices personalization and data extraction
- Enabled Google Services on unsupported devices (e.g., Huawei P40/Huawei P40 Pro).
- Extracted stored WiFi credentials from Android devices without rooting them via data mining.

title: About me
text:
My name is Marco Polo Bravo Montiel (the first two names are considered to be my “first name”, while the last two are considered to be my “last name”) and I’m 26 years old. I come from Puebla, a beautiful city located in the center of Mexico, my beloved homeland. I graduated from Universidad de las Américas Puebla (UDLAP), presumably, the best Mexican university (please don’t tell Alexi, haha). I did my undergrad in Actuarial Sciences and I have currently passed 3 SOA exams (P, FM and IFM). I also hold a Master’s Degree in Corporate Finance from that same university. I’ve worked for over 7 years as State Co-Delegate for the Mexican Mathematical Olympiad. In the last two years I’ve worked as a Data Analyst/Junior Data Scientist, and I’ve been professor at UDLAP.
I don’t know if other MDS students will actually visit this website in the coming days. However, this will definitely be read by a TA. Thank you for your hard work!

title: Marco Polo Bravo Montiel
text:
Master of Data Science | M.Sc. in Corporate Finance | B.Sc. in Actuarial Sciences


Marco Bravo graduated from the Master of Data Science programme at The University of British Columbia. He has extensive experience as a Data Scientist and Data Analyst, specializing in predictive modeling, data visualization, and the application of machine learning in the financial and mining industries. Marco is passionate about leveraging data to solve complex real-world problems and has a strong background in actuarial science and corporate finance.




Data Science
Machine Learning
Financial Modeling
Data Visualization
Risk
Probability and Statistics




Master of Data Science, University of British Columbia, Canada | September 2023 – June 2024
GPA: 91%
- Scholarship: Awarded the Master of Data Science (Domestic/International) Scholarship for academic and leadership achievements. - Capstone Project: Project DrillSense with RioTinto, developed a dashboard for visualizing global mining trends and applied ML algorithms to predict future drillholes. Demo
Master’s Degree in Corporate Finance, Universidad de las Américas Puebla, Mexico | June 2020 – December 2021
GPA: 3.96/4.00, Summa Cum Laude
- Specialization: Business Financial Management. - Scholarship: Institutional scholarship covering 60% of tuition. - Comprehensive Project: Developed a business solution for a beauty products franchise during Covid.
Bachelor’s Degree in Actuarial Sciences, Universidad de las Américas Puebla, Mexico | August 2016 – June 2020
GPA: 3.92/4.00, Magna Cum Laude
- Award: School of Science Scholar for highest marks in 2019. - Scholarship: Excellence scholarship covering 100% of tuitio



Data Scientist (Internship), Rio Tinto | Vancouver, BC | May 2024 – June 2024
- Developed a dashboard to visualize global mining trends. - Implemented ML algorithms to predict future drillholes. - Skills: Python, Data Visualization, Geodata, Mining Analytics.
Data Scientist, DATAKNOW S.A.S. | Mexico City, Mexico | July 2022 – August 2023
- Clustered financial data using ML tools for Grupo Bancolombia to ensure compliance with SARLAFT regulations. - Developed Python scripts and workflows to maintain model reproducibility. - Skills: R, Python, Data Analysis, Machine Learning, Hadoop, Apache Impala.
Assistant Teacher | Team Leader | Co-Delegate, Olimpiada Mexicana de Matemáticas | Puebla, Mexico | December 2015 – August 2023
- Conducted advanced mathematics courses and master classes for contestants. - Led teams in national competitions. - Participated in teaching workshops. - Skills: Leadership, Trustworthiness, Communication.
Lecturer, Universidad de las Américas Puebla | San Andrés Cholula, Mexico | January 2023 – May 2023
- Taught Actuarial Programming Tools to actuarial students. - Covered topics including Excel, VBA, MySQL, and collaborative programming. - Skills: Excel, VBA, MySQL, GitHub, Presentation Skills.
Data Analyst, Minsait | Mexico City, Mexico | February 2022 – August 2022
- Automated financial processes and developed valuation calculators for Banorte. - Validated and corrected hedging strategies in accounting books. - Skills: Excel, VBA, Data Analysis, Scala, Murex.
Data Analyst (Internship), Mexican Railways National Museum | Puebla, Mexico | June 2019 – March 2020
- Analyzed museum databases and automated data capture processes. - Developed an R script for reporting and analysis. - Skills: R, Excel, VBA, Presentation Skills.
